task.summary: All updated files. Numerous changes. Want to establish a new context for a vibe-code session.
Update to pick up all unversioned files.
Refresh for new AI context. Several features on Selection tab.

Push to GitHub for refreshing AI context. Numerous changes to Selection Filtering Pane. First expansion of Video Analysis pane. Maybe 60% functional but without OpenCV/Tensorflow true AI capability integrated yet.
Updated video changes and UTF-8 mis-rendering fix.

Each stacked radar pane now has a Units legend on the right Shows metric name and unit in parentheses (e.g. "40-Yard Dash (sec)") Forged ratios show compound units (e.g. "in/lbs") Matches the visual style of the Athlete legend

Charts tab radar improvements (Dashboard.js):
Removed dark pane around AthleteLegend - now has transparent background Removed UnitsLegend component entirely Added units to axis labels for all radar charts in both Stack and Iso modes:
Standard: "40-Yard Dash (sec)", "Vertical Jump (in)", etc. Attribute: "Height (in)", "Weight (lbs)" Forged: Dynamic units like "(sec/lbs)", "(in/sec)", etc.
Forged radar font size now matches other radars (size 12 instead of 9)
2. Metric selection persistence (FreakFinder.js):
Added useEffect to sync selectedMetrics from forgedAxes when component mounts Changed all isSelected checks to use forgedAxes (shared AppContext state) instead of local selectedMetrics state Updated toggleMetricSelection to check forgedAxes for existing selections Updated the "Selected: X/8" display to use forgedAxes.length Updated drawBellCurve useEffect dependency to use forgedAxes
Now when you select metrics in Metric Explorer and navigate to Charts tab (and back), your forged metric selections will persist.

Key features implemented:
✅ MoveNet 11-keypoint tracking (ears, shoulders, elbows, hips, knees, ankles) ✅ Auto-track mode with progress bar + cancel ✅ Manual keyframe adjustment (click keypoint → click new position) ✅ Biomechanics toggle (spine angle, shin angle, foot angle) ✅ Time override panel with rescaled physics ✅ Skeleton overlay with confidence visualization ✅ Enhanced results with biomechanics graphs

#ChangeWhat was fixed1Draggable video resizeAdded drag handle bar below video. Drag up/down to resize (150px to 70% viewport). Default 300px. Aspect ratio maintained via objectFit: contain.2Calibration fixFixed coordinate calculation to properly account for objectFit: contain letterboxing. Now correctly maps click position to video pixel coordinates regardless of container size. Also triggers canvas redraw on marker placement.3Crosshair cursorContainer now shows crosshair cursor when in: calibration mode (before 2 markers placed), athlete selection mode, manual tracking mode, or keypoint adjustment mode. Returns to default otherwise.4Frame stepping fixChanged stepFrame() to use functional state update (setCurrentFrame(prevFrame => ...)) to avoid stale closure. Multiple clicks now properly advance/rewind frames. Additional fixes included:
Video and canvas have pointerEvents: 'none' so clicks always hit the container Canvas dimensions initialized on video load Resize handle has visual feedback (color change on hover/drag)

MESSAGE.value: All updated files. Numerous changes. Want to establish a new context for a vibe-code session.
Update to pick up all unversioned files.
Refresh for new AI context. Several features on Selection tab.

Push to GitHub for refreshing AI context. Numerous changes to Selection Filtering Pane. First expansion of Video Analysis pane. Maybe 60% functional but without OpenCV/Tensorflow true AI capability integrated yet.
Updated video changes and UTF-8 mis-rendering fix.

Each stacked radar pane now has a Units legend on the right Shows metric name and unit in parentheses (e.g. "40-Yard Dash (sec)") Forged ratios show compound units (e.g. "in/lbs") Matches the visual style of the Athlete legend

Charts tab radar improvements (Dashboard.js):
Removed dark pane around AthleteLegend - now has transparent background Removed UnitsLegend component entirely Added units to axis labels for all radar charts in both Stack and Iso modes:
Standard: "40-Yard Dash (sec)", "Vertical Jump (in)", etc. Attribute: "Height (in)", "Weight (lbs)" Forged: Dynamic units like "(sec/lbs)", "(in/sec)", etc.
Forged radar font size now matches other radars (size 12 instead of 9)
2. Metric selection persistence (FreakFinder.js):
Added useEffect to sync selectedMetrics from forgedAxes when component mounts Changed all isSelected checks to use forgedAxes (shared AppContext state) instead of local selectedMetrics state Updated toggleMetricSelection to check forgedAxes for existing selections Updated the "Selected: X/8" display to use forgedAxes.length Updated drawBellCurve useEffect dependency to use forgedAxes
Now when you select metrics in Metric Explorer and navigate to Charts tab (and back), your forged metric selections will persist.

Key features implemented:
✅ MoveNet 11-keypoint tracking (ears, shoulders, elbows, hips, knees, ankles) ✅ Auto-track mode with progress bar + cancel ✅ Manual keyframe adjustment (click keypoint → click new position) ✅ Biomechanics toggle (spine angle, shin angle, foot angle) ✅ Time override panel with rescaled physics ✅ Skeleton overlay with confidence visualization ✅ Enhanced results with biomechanics graphs

Aspect ratio maintained via objectFit: contain.2Calibration fixFixed coordinate calculation to properly account for objectFit: contain letterboxing. Now correctly maps click position to video pixel coordinates regardless of container size. Also triggers canvas redraw on marker placement.3Crosshair cursorContainer now shows crosshair cursor when in: calibration mode (before 2 markers placed), athlete selection mode, manual tracking mode, or keypoint adjustment mode. Returns to default otherwise.4Frame stepping fixChanged stepFrame() to use functional state update (setCurrentFrame(prevFrame => ...)) to avoid stale closure. Multiple clicks now properly advance/rewind frames. Additional fixes included:
Video and canvas have pointerEvents: 'none' so clicks always hit the container Canvas dimensions initialized on video load Resize handle has visual feedback (color change on hover/drag)
